summary: This document is a chain of emails from January 2020 and earlier, primarily between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel, requesting and approving travel for the Epstein investigation (2018R01618). The emails detail planned trips for victim interviews in locations including Stockholm, Sweden; Los Angeles, California; and West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale, Florida. The correspondence shows the ongoing investigative work after Epstein's arrest.

persons.name: Alleyne
persons.context: Mentioned in the sender/recipient fields of emails requesting travel approval for the Epstein investigation. Likely a prosecutor on the case.

events.title: Planned Travel to Stockholm for Interview
events.description: Investigation team requests approval to travel to Stockholm, Sweden, for an interview related to the Epstein case. Specific flight and hotel details are discussed.

events.title: Planned Travel to Los Angeles for Interview
events.description: Request for permission to travel to Los Angeles for an interview (or interviews) in connection with the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned Travel to Los Angeles for Interview
events.description: Request for permission to travel to Los Angeles for an interview on November 14.

events.title: Planned Travel to West Palm Beach for Interview
events.description: Request for permission to travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for an interview. The request notes it will be just the requester and one other person.

events.title: Planned Travel to Los Angeles for Victim Interview
events.description: Request for permission to travel to Los Angeles for a victim interview. The team composition is noted as potentially including the requester and two other individuals.

events.title: Planned Travel to West Palm Beach for Meetings/Interviews
events.description: Request for permission to travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for approximately three days for meetings and interviews with victims.

events.title: Planned Travel to West Palm Beach for Meetings/Interviews
events.description: Request for permission to travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for meetings and interviews, explicitly linked to 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618'.

events.title: Initial Travel Request for Epstein Investigation
events.description: An early request for travel permission for 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618', describing it as an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity. The trip was for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale.

keyFacts: The document references the ongoing federal investigation 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618', described as relating to 'enticement of minors for sexual activity'.

The investigative team was conducting victim interviews in multiple domestic and international locations (Sweden, Los Angeles, Florida) well into 2020, indicating the scope of the probe continued after Epstein's death.
Travel requests detail standard government procedures, including seeking approval, using refundable tickets, adhering to per diem rates for hotels, and booking conference rooms for interviews.
The email chain shows coordination between prosecutors and administrative staff for logistical support related to the investigation.
The international trip to Stockholm in early 2020 suggests the investigation had leads or witnesses located outside the United States.
